analyzed: 與大苾芻眾千二百五十人俱。
translated: He was together with a great assembly of 1,250 bhikṣus.
There were also innumerable bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.
Maitreya Bodhisattva was at the head.

The great assembly surrounded him, making offerings, paying respect,
honoring him, praising him, and listening to the Dharma he expounded.

original: 爾時觀自在菩薩摩訶薩。
analyzed: 爾時觀自在菩薩摩訶薩。
translated: At that time, Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva-mahāsattva

analyzed: 與無量俱胝那庾多百千持呪神仙。 前後圍遶來詣佛所。
translated: was together with innumerable koṭis of nayutas of hundreds of thousands of mantra-holding sages,🔽surrounding him in front and behind as he came to where the Buddha was.
Upon arrival, he bowed his head at the feet of the World-Honored One.
Circumambulated the Buddha three times to the right and then sat to one side.
He addressed the Buddha, saying, World-Honored One,
I have a divine mantra-heart named Eleven Faces,
Endowed with great power and might.
It was spoken by 11 koṭis of buddhas.
I will now speak it.
In order to benefit and bring peace and happiness to all sentient beings,

original: 除一切病故滅一切惡故。
analyzed: 除一切病故滅一切惡故。
translated: To eliminate all illnesses, to destroy all evil,
To stop all inauspiciousness,
To ward off all evil dreams and thoughts,
To prevent all untimely deaths,

original: 欲令諸惡心者得調淨故。🔽有憂苦者得安樂故。
analyzed: 欲令諸惡心者得調淨故。 有憂苦者得安樂故。
translated: In order to subdue and purify those with evil minds,🔽To bring peace and happiness to those who have worries and suffering,
To bring reconciliation to those who have enmity and conflict,
To cause all demonic obstacles to be completely eliminated,
To fulfill all wishes and aspirations,

original: 世尊我不見世間若天若魔若梵若沙門若婆羅門等。
analyzed: 世尊我不見世間若天若魔若梵若沙門若婆羅門等。
translated: World-Honored One, I do not see in the world, whether devas, māras, Brahmā, śramaṇas, or brāhmaṇas,
Who can protect their bodies with this divine mantra,
Uphold, recite, copy, and disseminate it.
will be harmed by all calamities, misfortunes, demonic hindrances,

original: 刀杖毒藥厭禱呪術所能害者。
analyzed: 刀杖毒藥厭禱呪術所能害者。
translated: knives, sticks, poisons, spells, and sorcery.

original: 我亦不見以此神呪隨所住處。
analyzed: 我亦不見以此神呪隨所住處。
translated: I do not see this with the divine mantra, wherever it is,
whether far or near, having formed a boundary,
there will be none who can transgress it to come and harm.
Only those with determined evil karma to be ripened🔽will be able to do so.

original: 世尊彼當證知是事必爾。
analyzed: 世尊彼當證知是事必爾。
translated: World-Honored One, they will testify to this matter being so.
One should only have faith and accept it, not analyze it.
In this way, all calamities and misfortunes
will all be far removed and unable to encroach.
This divine mantra heart is praised by all buddhas
and rejoiced in by all.
All tathāgatas recollect and protect it.

original: 世尊我憶過去過殑伽沙等劫前。
analyzed: 世尊我憶過去過殑伽沙等劫前。
translated: World-Honored One, I remember more than a Ganges-sands number of eons ago,
there was a buddha who appeared in the world.

original: 名百蓮花眼無障礙頂熾盛功德光王如來應正等覺。
analyzed: 名百蓮花眼無障礙頂熾盛功德光王如來應正等覺。
translated: His name was the Tathāgata, the Worthy of Offerings, the Perfectly Enlightened One with a Hundred Lotus Eyes, an Unobstructed Crown, and the Radiance of the Glory of Meritorious Virtues.
At that time, I was a great sage.
and received this mantra from that World-Honored One.
When I obtained this mantra, I saw the Buddhas of the ten directions.
At that very moment, I attained the forbearance of the non-arising of dharmas.
Know that this mantra possesses great power and might.

original: 是故若有淨信善男子善女人等。
analyzed: 是故若有淨信善男子善女人等。
translated: Therefore, if there are men of pure faith and good women
who wish to uphold and recite this divine mantra,
they should respectfully focus their thoughts.
At each dawn, be pure in accordance with the Dharma,
and recite this mantra one hundred and eight times.
If one is able to do this,
in this very body one will obtain ten kinds of benefits.
What are the ten?
First, the body will always be free from illness.

original: 二者恒為十方諸佛攝受。
analyzed: 二者恒為十方諸佛攝受。
translated: Second, one will always be accepted and embraced by the Buddhas of the ten directions.

original: 三者財寶衣食受用無盡。
analyzed: 三者財寶衣食受用無盡。
translated: Third, one's enjoyment of wealth, treasures, clothing, and food will be inexhaustible.

original: 四者能伏怨敵而無所畏。
analyzed: 四者能伏怨敵而無所畏。
translated: Fourth, one will be able to subdue enemies and have nothing to fear.

original: 五者令諸尊貴恭敬先言。
analyzed: 五者令諸尊貴恭敬先言。
translated: Fifth, one will cause the noble and exalted to respect and honor one.

original: 六者蠱毒鬼魅不能中傷。
analyzed: 六者蠱毒鬼魅不能中傷。
translated: Sixth, one will not be harmed by poisons, ghosts, or spirits.

original: 七者一切刀杖所不能害。
analyzed: 七者一切刀杖所不能害。
translated: Seventh, one will not be harmed by any weapons or sticks.
Eighth, one will not drown in water.
Ninth, one will not be burned by fire.
Tenth, one will never die an untimely death.
One will also attain four kinds of meritorious and victorious benefits.

original: 一者臨命終時得見諸佛。
analyzed: 一者臨命終時得見諸佛。
translated: First, at the time of death, one will be able to see the buddhas.
Second, one will never fall into the evil destinies.
Third, one will not die due to danger and misfortune.
Fourth, one will be reborn in the Land of Ultimate Bliss.

original: 世尊我憶過去過十殑伽沙等劫。
analyzed: 世尊我憶過去過十殑伽沙等劫。
translated: World-Honored One, I recall that in the past, more than ten Ganges Rivers' sands of eons ago,
and even further back, there was a buddha who appeared in the world.

original: 名美音香如來應正等覺。
analyzed: 名美音香如來應正等覺。
translated: His name was the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, with a pleasant voice and fragrance.
At that time, I was a great householder.
I received this dhāraṇī from that buddha.

original: 得此呪時便於生死超四萬劫。
analyzed: 得此呪時便於生死超四萬劫。
translated: When I obtained this dhāraṇī, I transcended forty thousand eons of birth and death.
Reciting and upholding this dhāraṇī,

original: 復得諸佛大悲智藏一切菩薩解脫法門。
analyzed: 復得諸佛大悲智藏一切菩薩解脫法門。
translated: I further attained the great compassionate wisdom treasury and the liberation Dharma door of all bodhisattvas.

original: 由此威力能救一切牢獄繫閉。
analyzed: 由此威力能救一切牢獄繫閉。
translated: By this power, I am able to save all those imprisoned, bound,
handcuffed, shackled, and about to be executed.
Water, fire, wind, thieves, poison, and evil spells.

original: 人非人等種種苦難。🔽由此我於一切有情。
analyzed: 人非人等種種苦難。 由此我於一切有情。
translated: Various difficulties caused by humans and non-humans.

original: 能作歸依救護安慰洲渚室宅。
analyzed: 能作歸依救護安慰洲渚室宅。
translated: Because of this, I am able to be a refuge, protector, and comfort for all sentient beings, like an island and a house.

original: 以此呪力攝取一切勃惡藥叉邏剎娑等。
analyzed: 以此呪力攝取一切勃惡藥叉邏剎娑等。
translated: By the power of this mantra, I gather in all the vicious yakshas, rakshasas, and others.
First, I cause them to give rise to a compassionate mind and a mind of pity.

original: 然後安立於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
analyzed: 然後安立於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translated: Then, I establish them in supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: 世尊我此神呪有大威力。
analyzed: 世尊我此神呪有大威力。
translated: World-Honored One, this divine mantra has great power.

original: 若誦一遍即能除滅四根本罪。
analyzed: 若誦一遍即能除滅四根本罪。
translated: If recited once, it can eliminate the four fundamental offenses and
the five heinous crimes, leaving no remainder.
How much more so for those who practice as taught!

original: 若有曾於百千俱胝那庾多佛所種諸善根。
analyzed: 若有曾於百千俱胝那庾多佛所種諸善根。
translated: If one has planted various roots of goodness in the presence of hundreds of thousands of koṭis of nayutas of Buddhas,
One will then be able to hear this mantra.
How much more so for those who are able to uphold it and practice as taught!

original: 若能晝夜讀誦受持此神呪者。
analyzed: 若能晝夜讀誦受持此神呪者。
translated: If one is able to read, recite, and uphold this divine mantra day and night,

original: 我當令彼所有願求悉得如意。
analyzed: 我當令彼所有願求悉得如意。
translated: I will cause all their wishes to be fulfilled as they desire.
If there are those who can, every half month,

analyzed: 或第十四日或第十五日。
translated: on the fourteenth or fifteenth day,
uphold the precepts of the fast in accordance with the Dharma, pure and clean,
focus their minds on me and recite this divine mantra,
they will transcend forty thousand eons in the cycle of birth and death.
World-Honored One, because of this mantra,
my name and noble status are difficult to hear.

original: 若有稱念百千俱胝那庾多諸佛名號。
analyzed: 若有稱念百千俱胝那庾多諸佛名號。
translated: If there are those who chant the names of a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of buddhas,

translated: and there are those who temporarily single-mindedly chant my name,

All those who chant my name

translated: Free from all illnesses, liberated from all hindrances and all fears,

translated: and able to eliminate the evils of body, speech, and mind.

One should know that this person, with regard to unsurpassed enlightenment,
Then one will receive it as if holding it in the palm of one's hand.

original: 爾時世尊讚觀自在菩薩言。
analyzed: 爾時世尊讚觀自在菩薩言。
translated: At that time the World-Honored One praised Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva, saying:

Good man, by this expedient means,
You are able to rescue and deliver all sentient beings from

analyzed: 若入道場欲以花香鬘供養時。
translated: If entering the ritual arena and wishing to make offerings with flowers, incense, and garlands,

analyzed: 先以此呪呪花七遍用散尊像。 復以此呪呪香七遍以塗尊像。

analyzed: 敬禮聖智海遍照莊嚴王如來。

translated: If one wishes to make offerings to the Buddha with food, drink, flowers, fruits, and so forth,

translated: first recite this mantra twenty-one times and then present them.

analyzed: 敬禮聖智海遍照莊嚴王如來。
translated: Homage to the Holy Tathāgata Samantabhadra, the King of Adornments Who Illuminates the Ocean of Wisdom.

original: 若欲以上根本神呪隨事有所作時。
analyzed: 若欲以上根本神呪隨事有所作時。
translated: If one wishes to use the fundamental divine mantra to accomplish various tasks,

analyzed: 先以此呪呪闍底花木一遍擬用然火。
translated: first recite this mantra once over jati flower wood to be used for burning.
Then take jati flower wood separately.
Cut it into thirty-one segments.
Soak it in ghee, butter, and honey overnight.
Take one segment each time and recite the mantra once over it.
Throw it into the fire until it is all used up.
Then accomplish what is to be done according to the task.
Pay homage to the Three Jewels.

original: 敬禮聖智海遍照莊嚴王如來。
analyzed: 敬禮聖智海遍照莊嚴王如來。

analyzed: 敬禮一切如來應正等覺。
translated: Pay homage to all Tathagatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Enlightened Ones.

analyzed: 敬禮聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩大悲者。
translated: Pay homage to the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avalokitesvara, the Greatly Compassionate One.

original: 怛姪他　壹履弭履一比履底丁里反下同履二止履呬履三莎訶四世尊此是結界呪。
analyzed: 怛姪他　壹履弭履一比履底丁里反下同履二止履呬履三莎訶四世尊此是結界呪。
translated: Tadyatha, ilvimilvi, bilvimi, sthavimi, svaha. World-Honored One, this is the mantra for establishing boundaries.
When wishing to establish boundaries, first use this mantra.
Consecrate water with it seven times and sprinkle it in the four directions.
Or one can enchant black mustard seeds or enchanted pure ash.

original: 皆至七遍散四方面隨心遠近。
analyzed: 皆至七遍散四方面隨心遠近。
translated: All up to seven times, scatter in the four directions, as far as one wishes.
Then form a boundary to provide protection.
Respectfully bow to the Three Jewels.

original: 敬禮聖智海遍照莊嚴王如來。
analyzed: 敬禮聖智海遍照莊嚴王如來。
translated: Respectfully bow to the Holy Omniscient Ocean Illuminating Adornment King Tathāgata.

translated: Respectfully bow to the Holy Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, the Greatly Compassionate One.

original: 怛姪他　比胝比胝一底胝底胝二止胝止胝三費房匪下同胝費胝四揭車揭車五薄迦梵六阿唎耶婆肥何反盧枳低濕伐囉七颯縛婆縛去聲呼南八莎訶九世尊此是請我還自宮呪。

translated: Tadyathā bhikṣabhikṣa bhikṣa bhikṣa sthika sthika sthika sthika phuk pha phuk pha gaccha gaccha pakṣaṃ ārya avalokiteśvara svāhā. O World-Honored One, this is the mantra for inviting me to return to my own palace.
If the work is completed,
When inviting me to return to my own palace,

original: 應以此呪呪水七遍散灑四方我便還去。
analyzed: 應以此呪呪水七遍散灑四方我便還去。
translated: One should use this mantra to enchant water seven times and sprinkle it in the four directions. I will then return.

original: 世尊如是神呪雖不成立。
analyzed: 世尊如是神呪雖不成立。
translated: Although the World-Honored One's divine mantra is not established in this way,
it is still able to perform various deeds.
If one single-mindedly recites it, one will not fail to obtain one's wishes.

original: 若患瘧病或一日一發或二日一發。
analyzed: 若患瘧病或一日一發或二日一發。
translated: If one suffers from malaria that recurs every day, every other day,

analyzed: 或三日一發或四日一發。
translated: every third day, or every fourth day,

original: 若患鬼病或部多鬼所作。🔽或茶耆上聲呼尼所作或畢舍遮所作。🔽或羯吒平聲呼布怛那所作。
analyzed: 若患鬼病或部多鬼所作。 或茶耆上聲呼尼所作或畢舍遮所作。 或羯吒平聲呼布怛那所作。
translated: or if one suffers from a ghost illness caused by a bhūta ghost,🔽a cāṇḍāla ghost, a piśāca ghost,🔽a kaṭapūtana ghost,

original: 或癲鬼所作或癎鬼所作。
analyzed: 或癲鬼所作或癎鬼所作。
translated: a ghost that causes epilepsy, a ghost that causes infantile convulsions,
or other various kinds of evil ghosts,
one should use this mantra to recite over the patient

analyzed: 一百八遍即得除愈若障重者用五色縷誦呪作結。
translated: one hundred and eight times, and they will be cured. If the obstruction is heavy, use five-colored thread to recite the mantra and tie knots,
one knot for each recitation, a total of one hundred and eight knots.

original: 以繫病人頸上或繫臂上。
analyzed: 以繫病人頸上或繫臂上。
translated: Tie it around the patient's neck or arm.
evil karma,

analyzed: 消滅病即除愈若患丁腫癰腫瘻瘡疱瘡。
translated: If suffering from boils, carbuncles, tumors, sores,
or various other evil diseases such as leprosy,
if wounded by swords, arrows, spears, etc.,
or bitten by snakes, scorpions, centipedes, poisonous bees, etc.,

original: 皆以此呪呪之七遍即得除愈若障重者呪黃土埿至一七遍。
analyzed: 皆以此呪呪之七遍即得除愈若障重者呪黃土埿至一七遍。
translated: all should use this mantra to chant it seven times and they will be cured. If the obstruction is heavy, chant yellow earth mud up to one seven times.

original: 用塗病處所苦得除愈。🔽若患緩風偏風𮌓風。
analyzed: 用塗病處所苦得除愈。 若患緩風偏風𮌓風。
translated: Use it to smear the afflicted area and the pain will be cured.🔽If suffering from paralysis, hemiplegia, or convulsions,
deafness, nasal congestion, or numbness,
all should sincerely recite this mantra.

original: 呪彼患者一百八遍病即除愈若障重者以油或酥。
analyzed: 呪彼患者一百八遍病即除愈若障重者以油或酥。
translated: If the obstruction is heavy, use oil or ghee.

original: 煎樺皮及青木香每呪七遍。
analyzed: 煎樺皮及青木香每呪七遍。
translated: Boil birch bark and agarwood, chanting the mantra seven times each time.
Then use it to smear the body or drip it into the ears and nose.

original: 或令服之所患便愈若有所餘種種疾病。
analyzed: 或令服之所患便愈若有所餘種種疾病。
translated: Or have them ingest it and the affliction will be cured. If there are other various illnesses,
all should sincerely use this mantra.
Or recite it oneself and one will be cured.

original: 世尊若欲成立此神呪者。
analyzed: 世尊若欲成立此神呪者。
translated: World-Honored One, if one wishes to accomplish this divine mantra,

original: 應當先以堅好無隙白栴檀香。
analyzed: 應當先以堅好無隙白栴檀香。
translated: One should first use solid, fine, and flawless white sandalwood
To carve an image of Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva,

original: 長一搩手半。🔽左手執紅蓮花軍持。
analyzed: 長一搩手半。 左手執紅蓮花軍持。
translated: One and a half cubits tall.🔽The left hand holds a red lotus flower and a water jar,
The right arm is extended, holding a rosary,
And makes the gesture of granting fearlessness.
The image has eleven faces.
The three main faces have a compassionate appearance.
The three faces on the left have an angry appearance.

original: 右邊三面作白牙上出相。
analyzed: 右邊三面作白牙上出相。
translated: The three faces on the right have the appearance of upper teeth protruding.

original: 當後一面作暴惡大笑相。
analyzed: 當後一面作暴惡大笑相。
translated: The face at the back has the appearance of a ferocious, loud laugh.
The face at the top is the appearance of a Buddha's face.
In the crowns of all the heads are images of the Buddha's body.
On the body of Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva,
It is adorned with various ornaments such as necklaces.
Having created this image, one who seeks wishes,
Wears new, clean clothes and observes precepts.
From the first day of the bright fortnight to the eighth day,
Recite this mantra three times daily.
One hundred and eight times or an immeasurable number of times.

original: 從此以後於一靜處敷清淨座。
analyzed: 從此以後於一靜處敷清淨座。
translated: From then on, in a quiet place, spread a pure seat.

original: 安置所造觀自在菩薩像面向西方。
analyzed: 安置所造觀自在菩薩像面向西方。
translated: Place the created image of Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva facing west.
Offer various foods according to one's ability.
Only burn agarwood and frankincense.
The practitioner should eat barley and drink milk.
As before, recite until the thirteenth day.

original: 從此以後所設供具須倍勝前。
analyzed: 從此以後所設供具須倍勝前。
translated: From then on, the offerings set out should be twice as excellent as before.
The practitioner should only eat the three white foods.
That is, milk, yogurt, and rice.
Take wood from a bodhi tree, light a fire in front of the image,

original: 復取彼木寸截以為一千八段。
analyzed: 復取彼木寸截以為一千八段。
translated: and cut it into one thousand and eight segments.
Soak it in duruka-colored fragrant oil.
Take one segment each time and recite the mantra once.
Throw it into the fire until it is all used up.
At that time, the earth will tremble violently.
Because of this, the image will also move.

original: 從最上面口中出聲讚行者言。
analyzed: 從最上面口中出聲讚行者言。
translated: From the mouth at the very top, a voice praises the practitioner, saying:
Excellent, excellent, good man!
You are able to diligently seek your wish in this way.
I will cause your wish to be fulfilled.
I will cause you to soar through the air from here.
Or I will cause you to roam without obstruction.
Or I will make you the king among mantra-holding sages.
Or I will cause you to be free and unobstructed like me.

original: 復次行者或於白月第十五日。
analyzed: 復次行者或於白月第十五日。
translated: Next, the practitioner, on the fifteenth day of the bright half of the month,

original: 以十一面觀自在菩薩像。
analyzed: 以十一面觀自在菩薩像。
translated: with an image of the Eleven-Faced Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva,
places it in a stūpa that contains a Buddha relic.
Wearing new clean clothes, they observe the precepts of the fast.
For a day and a night, they do not drink or eat.
They take one thousand and eight sumana flowers.
For each flower, they recite the mantra once.
They throw it onto the image until they are all used up.
At that time, the face of the image in front
emits a voice from its mouth, like the roar of thunder.
This will cause the earth to quake.
At that time, the practitioner should calm their mind.
Do not be afraid, but recite the divine mantra.
Request the desired vow, saying thus:

original: 敬禮聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩大悲者。🔽我於何時能與一切有情作大依怙。
analyzed: 敬禮聖觀自在菩薩摩訶薩大悲者。 我於何時能與一切有情作大依怙。
translated: Respectfully pay homage to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Avalokiteśvara, the greatly compassionate one.🔽When can I become a great refuge for all sentient beings?

original: 能滿一切有情心之所願。
analyzed: 能滿一切有情心之所願。
translated: When can I fulfill the wishes in the minds of all sentient beings?

original: 時觀自在便與其願。🔽當與願時諸天龍等。
analyzed: 時觀自在便與其願。 當與願時諸天龍等。
translated: At that time, Avalokiteśvara will grant their wish.🔽When granting the wish, no devas, nāgas, etc.
Can create obstacles for them.
Next, when there is a lunar eclipse,
Take one tael of ghee and store it in a silver vessel.
Place it in front of this image and recite this mantra.
Until the moon returns to its original state,

original: 便取食之身中諸病無不除愈。
analyzed: 便取食之身中諸病無不除愈。
translated: Then take it and eat it. All illnesses in the body will be cured.
Next, the practitioner,
Should take equal parts of orpiment and ox bezoar.

original: 置此像前念誦此呪一千八遍。
analyzed: 置此像前念誦此呪一千八遍。
translated: Place it in front of this image and recite this mantra 1,080 times.
Mix it with water and apply it between the eyebrows.
The three accomplishments are as explained before.
If one bathes the body with warm water mixed with it,

original: 則一切障礙一切惡夢一切疫病。
analyzed: 則一切障礙一切惡夢一切疫病。
translated: then all obstacles, all bad dreams, and all epidemics
will all be cured.

original: 復次若他方怨賊欲來侵境。
analyzed: 復次若他方怨賊欲來侵境。
translated: Furthermore, if a hostile army from another country is about to invade the territory,
one should take one piece of sparrow fat,

original: 誦此呪呪之一百八遍莊點此像。
analyzed: 誦此呪呪之一百八遍莊點此像。
translated: recite this mantra and enchant it one hundred and eight times, and apply it to this image.
The angry face on the left should face directly in that direction.
It will prevent the hostile army from advancing.

original: 復次若國土中人畜疫起。
analyzed: 復次若國土中人畜疫起。
translated: Furthermore, if epidemics break out among humans and animals in a country,
in front of this image, one should light a fire using jujube wood.
Then, take that wood again,
cut it into one thousand and eight pieces,
take each piece, smear it with mustard seed oil,

original: 呪之一遍擲置火中乃至皆盡。
analyzed: 呪之一遍擲置火中乃至皆盡。
translated: enchant it once with the mantra and throw it into the fire until it is all used up.
Then, take red thread, enchant it seven times,

original: 一呪一結繫置最上佛面頂上。
analyzed: 一呪一結繫置最上佛面頂上。
translated: enchanting each knot, and tie it on top of the Buddha's face.Here is the corrected and aligned text:
Causing all epidemics to be completely eliminated.
After the epidemic is gone, untie the spell rope.

original: 復次若有卒為茶耆上聲呼尼部多鬼等魅著成病。🔽應取白縷作二十一呪結。
analyzed: 復次若有卒為茶耆上聲呼尼部多鬼等魅著成病。 應取白縷作二十一呪結。
translated: Next, if there are suddenly those afflicted by the Tejani ghosts,
One should take white thread and make twenty-one knots, chanting once for each knot.

original: 繫著當前慈悲面頂上。🔽經一宿已解取。
analyzed: 繫著當前慈悲面頂上。 經一宿已解取。
translated: Tie it to the top of the compassionate face in front.

original: 以繫病人頸上病即除愈。
analyzed: 以繫病人頸上病即除愈。
translated: After one night, untie it and tie it around the patient's neck. The illness will then be cured.
If the karmic hindrances are heavy and it is not cured,

original: 應取此索更呪一百八遍。
analyzed: 應取此索更呪一百八遍。
translated: One should take this rope and chant over it one hundred and eight times.

original: 繫前所繫像頂上。🔽經一宿已解取。
analyzed: 繫前所繫像頂上。 經一宿已解取。
translated: Tie it to the top of the previously tied image.

original: 以繫病人頸上必得除愈。
analyzed: 以繫病人頸上必得除愈。
translated: After one night, untie it and tie it around the patient's neck. It will definitely be cured.

original: 復次若有長病困苦不差。
analyzed: 復次若有長病困苦不差。
translated: Next, if there is a chronic illness that is not cured,
Or if evil spirits and ghosts come into the house,
One should take one hundred and eight pieces of frankincense,
Chanting once for each piece in front of this image.
Throw it into the fire until it is all used up.

original: 復取白縷作二十一呪結。
analyzed: 復取白縷作二十一呪結。
translated: Take white thread and make twenty-one knots,
reciting the mantra once for each knot.
Tie it in front of the compassionate face on the top of the head.
After spending one night, untie it and take it.
Tie it on the neck of the sick person.

original: 所患除愈惡鬼退散。🔽復次若為怨讎伺求其便。
analyzed: 所患除愈惡鬼退散。 復次若為怨讎伺求其便。
translated: Their illness will be cured and evil ghosts will retreat and scatter.🔽Next, if there are enemies seeking an opportunity to harm,
or if there is a dispute or curse that will bring misfortune,

original: 應以種種香花等物供養此像。
analyzed: 應以種種香花等物供養此像。
translated: One should make offerings to this image with various incense, flowers, and other items.
In front of the bhasmaka wood image, light a fire.
Take one hundred and eight mustard seeds.
Recite the mantra once for each seed and throw it into the fire.

original: 復取白縷結作一百八結。
analyzed: 復取白縷結作一百八結。
translated: Take white thread and make one hundred and eight knots.
Recite the mantra once for each knot.

original: 繫著此像左邊瞋面頂上。
analyzed: 繫著此像左邊瞋面頂上。
translated: Tie it on the top of the head of the angry face on the left side of the image.
After spending one night, untie the rope and take it.

original: 稱怨讎名截一一結各令異處。
analyzed: 稱怨讎名截一一結各令異處。
translated: Recite the name of the enemy and cut each knot into different pieces.
Recite once and cut once until it is all used up.

original: 今彼怨讎所作不遂自然歸伏。
analyzed: 今彼怨讎所作不遂自然歸伏。
translated: Now the enemy's plans will not succeed and they will naturally submit.

original: 復次若人欲求諸善好事。
analyzed: 復次若人欲求諸善好事。
translated: Furthermore, if a person wishes to seek all good and auspicious things,

original: 取五色縷結作呪索一百八結。
analyzed: 取五色縷結作呪索一百八結。
translated: Take five-colored threads and knot them into a mantra rope with one hundred and eight knots.
Recite the mantra once for each knot.
Again, in front of the image, recite it seven times.
Tie it in front of the compassionate face and place it on the crown of the head.
After one night, untie it and take it.
Tie it to one's own body. What is sought will be as one wishes.

original: 復次若知身中有諸障難。
analyzed: 復次若知身中有諸障難。
translated: Furthermore, if one knows that there are various obstacles in the body,
And the sought-after good things often do not accord with one's wishes,
With misfortune arriving from time to time without cause,
One should bathe this image's body with fragrant water.

original: 復取此水呪之一百八遍。
analyzed: 復取此水呪之一百八遍。
translated: Again, take this water and recite the mantra one hundred and eight times.
Use it to bathe the image of Vinayaka.

original: 復取呪之一百八遍自灑其身。
analyzed: 復取呪之一百八遍自灑其身。
translated: Again, take it and recite it one hundred and eight times, and sprinkle it on one's own body.
All obstacles and difficulties will naturally disappear.
All that is sought will be as one wishes.

original: 爾時觀自在菩薩摩訶薩說此經已。
analyzed: 爾時觀自在菩薩摩訶薩說此經已。
translated: At that time, Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, having spoken this sūtra,
All the great assembly simultaneously praised, saying:
Excellent, excellent, great being!

original: 乃能為欲利益安樂諸有情故說此神呪。
analyzed: 乃能為欲利益安樂諸有情故說此神呪。
translated: You are able to speak this divine mantra for the sake of benefiting and bringing peace and happiness to all sentient beings.
We rejoice and also wish to uphold it.
At that time, the great assembly rejoiced and leaped for joy.
They circumambulated the Buddha three times, made obeisance, and departed.
